website_summaries.verdict: The dual material head offers outstanding flexibility, and the durable fiberglass handle wrapped in a comfort grip allows for frequent use without wear on the hands or the mallet.
pros: The black rubber side of the head is hard enough to strike with power, while the soft white side can pound out metal and other materials without leaving black marks like some other mallets
The fiberglass handle is built to last and will also absorb impact better than other handles
cons: The mallet head may come off with frequent  use on very hard material such as stone

customer_reviews.title: I now have a gofer free lawn!
customer_reviews.text: Prior to getting this rubber mallet, I’d have to hit my lawn gofers with a metal hammer, which was harder and made a big mess when I hit one right on. Now, with this rubber mallet, I can more accurately strike the gofers as they pop up, and the softer strike surface allows me to daze them rather than make their head explode. Seriously recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammer for leather working also....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just to try it out with my leather hole punches. I have literally beat this thing to death and it has held up way better than I ever expected it to. I make batches of hand made mouse pads to where I am pounding holes all day sometimes and I just wanted something with a longer handle. The grip is very nice and does not hurt my hand at all using it for hours at a time. All in all I am very happy with this purchase and if you are also looking for something durable and a bit longer this might be just what you are looking for. 5 Stars all the way... I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am using this Tekton mallet to insert 80 feet of plastic edging in various parts of my Florida lawn. This lightweight, but tough mallet has been a lifesaver. While doing this project, this mallet gets dirty and wet. Its cushioned handle prevents my hands from slipping and its cushioned head provides a damage-free, but effective strike. Despite 30 days of hot sun, mud, rain, clay, and multiple cleaning sessions with the garden hose, my mallet has retained its original appearance.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Every tool chest should have one
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality well built hammer for the money. Every tool chest should have a rubber mallet. This has a dual use as one face is what (non marking) and one face black (very soft). The soft face can be used on wood and metal without damaging. The grip is comfortable and secure. Large face allows you hit your target every time. I used this mallet for leveling flagstone. I would buy again. If this review was helpful please let me know by clicking the “Helpful” button below the review
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice. Very heavy duty. Very good quality. However if you're a senior or do not have much strength in your arms it may be just a little heavy and you may want to go with a little bit lighter rubber mallet but overall I think it's a great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.author: Pem

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight mallet at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a few various TEKTON tools over the last year. I was in need of a new rubber mallet and the price seemed very fair so I figured I would give it a shot. I was pleasantly surprised on the build quality of this when I received it. Has a nice nonslip grip wrapped around a lightweight fiberglass handle. The rubber head feels firm when striking and even though I have the black version it didn't appear to leave any marks on anything I struck. UPDATE 08/04/2016: Included some photos after I just used it to diagnose the source of a heat shield rattle.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Corners chunk and flake off after a single use on wood
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my old rubber mallet this doesn't compare. The corners quickly chunked and flaked off after a single use driving wood. It took my old mallet years to deteriorate to this level.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Ponch

customer_reviews.title: NOT construction or automotive grade
customer_reviews.text: The rubber on this is trash. Dont waste your time unless you are using this on soft or flat stuff. I was lightly tapping a U joint and pieces of rubber started falling off. Its super dry rubber. This is 100% NOT construction or automotive grade at all. Ill be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Bellworx

customer_reviews.title: I needed this...no...wanted my very own rubber mallet for my own toolbox.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to buy myself a new tool for my new tool box. I used this rubber mallet today to assist with assembling metal shelving. It is lightweight and help do the job! I love the quality too! My dad taught me to care for and clean tools. Having my own, alleviates the stress of digging into my husbands tool box - yuk! Love my rubber mallett!
customer_reviews.author: KAREN K.

customer_reviews.title: Awful Quality Mallet - Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Worst. Mallet. Ever. After ONE USE of hammering plastic stakes into the ground to hold down plastic tarp outside, somehow the rubber mallet lost a chunk at the edge of the mallet. I will NEVER buy Tekton ever again, congrats on losing a 24 year old customer forever.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cortese

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes you need a soft touch
customer_reviews.text: This 1 pound rubber mallet is very sturdy. Unlike other rubber hammers, this one has a fiberglass handle (very important), instead of a wooden or plastic handle. The rubber head is soft enough that it will not break of pieces as you strike solid objects and hard enough to get the job done; the perfect balance between too much and too little. However, I cannot comment on longevity, except to say the product is well made and from the looks of it, I expect it to last many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Great non marking mallet for your needs.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product for 6 months now. I have used it for car repair, home improvement, demolition, etc... it hasn't failed me yet. I chose the white rubber as it does not leave a visible mark on most surfaces. The handle is comfortable and the fiberglass handle is light and strong. You won't be disappointed with this mallet. I will update this review if any changes occur.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: You won't need the 32 oz.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure whether the 16 oz would cut it (it looked kind of small in the pictures), but it will absolutely handle any task you can throw at it. Unless you're driving massive stakes into sun baked soil, the 16 oz will definitely get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: jmt

customer_reviews.title: Empowering for kitchen and gardening.
customer_reviews.text: Great for pounding stakes in the Garden and equally helpful for pounding chicken breasts into flattened filets. Haven’t tried it to pound some sense into my husbands head yet but looks promising. It’s a must have!
customer_reviews.author: pegge c.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: I have needed a rubber mallet on so many occasions and have never had one. In the midst of a project requiring one, I hoped on the Amazon app and ordered this guy. It gets five stars for giving me the piece of mind that I will never have another sore palm from manually pushing or risk breaking another tool (or product) that's clearly not designed for the job. Now that I own it, I'll probably never have the need for it again. But if I do, I'll be ready!
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Not particularly durable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a hardwood floor installation and had to replace it before I was halfway through. Edges began wearing where the hammer met the edge of the wood and started marking the wood. The marks did wipe off but it was one more thing to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Black and White
customer_reviews.text: I love that this has both a black side and a white side depending on what surface you need it for so that you can avoid scuff marks. Sturdy with a good weight, yet not too heavy. A great tool to add to my toolbox and a decent price, too!
customer_reviews.author: The Bull

customer_reviews.title: Handle came loose from the rubber head.
customer_reviews.text: At first this seemed like a very nice mallot, but The handle came loose after the first 30 days. It appears that 1 nail holds the handle to the rubber, so after several solid strikes with it, the nail works it's way loose from the rubber. I filled the gap with epoxy and shoved the handle back in. So far so good, but I dont expect it to last forever this way.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lewin

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Head Crumbles
customer_reviews.text: First it arrived used & had slight damage to the head. I was looking for a mallot to tap my ice bags to break up the ice. The rubber on the head has already crumbled & broken off after slight taps to the ice. This is exactly what I was trying to avoid. This mallot is no better than my Dollar Tree mallot or my Wal-Mart mallot.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Seller tactics
customer_reviews.text: Product is good, quality is good for price. Was upset due to the fact that hammer canse damage. On the handle part at the bottom a big piece was missing. Looks like a grinder was put to handle literally. How did tekton shipped hammer like this. I kept hammer due to hassle returning it and so forth. Most likely will not buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rebar steaks
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a US American flag kit that we put up in our front yard. The kit comes with a long piece of rebar that you hammer into the ground. We were using a regular hammer but it was damaging the top of the rebar. This did the trick, we can easily put the rebar in the ground and not damage it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Enabled me to assemble a deck box.
customer_reviews.text: The deck box instructions asked for a mallet. This was ordered this to comply with the instructions. In fact, I don't believe I could have assembled the box by myself without the mallet. The section that required using the mallet became one of the easiest sections to assemble. Update: Who knew I would use this again? It enabled me to assemble a cedar planter on tall legs by myself.
customer_reviews.author: morningglory

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely NOT for nails
customer_reviews.text: This mallet is definitely not for everything. We bought it on an IKEA items assembly streak trying to cut down the noise as we sometimes assembled the furniture in the evening. The quality of the item is very good. Our mistake is, we didn't know it's completely inappropriate for nails, so had to purchase a hammer afterwards. For other purposes, it's nice and sturdy. The only downside is that it marks pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, local better
customer_reviews.text: I expected much better. The local 99cent store had basically the same thing for cheaper. Neither the grip nor the weight are anything note worthy, using for a bit let marks in my hands. Either check out local store or spend a few dollars more on a better one
customer_reviews.author: Michael Step

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what a rubber mallet should be
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy. It's light. It has a non-marking side. Everything is great. It did come with a chemical smell to it that I mistook for burning electronics (i.e., smelled like a resistor burning up), so I would not advise licking or eating it. But to each his own.
customer_reviews.author: T. Song

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was the best product I could find on the INTERNET for a quality rubber mallet. YES I would buy this rubber mallet again.
customer_reviews.author: George Saba

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It appears the white half of this is not a solid color but a white coating over tan color rubber. There was a chip of this white coating missing near where the black & white meet up. This is what you get I guess for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Mallet crumbling to pieces within minutes
customer_reviews.text: I must not really understand what a rubber maker is for, for just minutes into using this to bang on my small ax to split wood into smaller pieces for kindling ... my precious new mallet was already crumbling to pieces. (see photo) I’d have given 1 star, but I added two to account for what may just be my ignorance.
customer_reviews.author: B. Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! 16 oz. TEKTON Rubber Mallet
customer_reviews.text: Rubber mallet is about 13 and 1/2 inches in length. Mellet face is about 2 and 3/16 inches diameter. Mellet head length is about 3 and 3/4 inches. I love this mallet. I've used it a lot already including pounding stakes into the yard (lawn edging and holiday inflatables) and shutting paint/stain can.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Weight & Comfort are there!
customer_reviews.text: Nice mallet. Weight was there and it doesn’t sound like sand! Comfortable to use and built to last! Not much can go wrong. This is a good choice. I keep one in the garage and one in the basement. Well worth having around!
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: In this case the finish between the handle and the head is rough and the grip could be a bit better for my big hands
customer_reviews.text: It works. It had not come apart under tough usage and I can even use it in the kitchen to flatten chicken breasts. Why not four stars? Well, I am quite fussy and rarely give five stars to anything. In this case the finish between the handle and the head is rough and the grip could be a bit better for my big hands. These are minor points.
customer_reviews.author: Voltrex7

customer_reviews.title: Bought used. Works like new.
customer_reviews.text: This part was purchased from the Amazon Warehouse for a discounted price. Aside from a few apparent usage marks on the face of the strike surface, it is as good as new. Well balanced. Good bang for the buck. (pun)
customer_reviews.author: A. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Good, but wish there was better quality control. Part of the rubber area was damaged but did not effect the use.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Too often a fiberglass handle will break after excessive use. It does help with impact absorption and making the item weigh less. It will not rust. *Good for wood work and carpet installation.
customer_reviews.author: TrojanChica

customer_reviews.title: And it is nice to have the lifetime guarantee in case it does ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of Tekton tools. They have big name quality, for a fraction of the cost. And it is nice to have the lifetime guarantee in case it does end up breaking. The handle seems securely fitted to the mallet, and the overall quality seems excellent especially considering the cost. I highly recommend this if you are in the market for a rubber mallet.. which if you are reading this review chances are that you are.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Curtis

customer_reviews.title: You need a rubber mallet in your life!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. And it will last my son a lifetime. His apartment warming gift was so helpful for putting together the new furniture, but more importantly, It prevented damage when he used it to bang the pieces apart when he realized that he'd put it together incorrectly! He had seen me use one in the past for many things, but didn't realize how important having one of his own would be some day. That day has finally come!
customer_reviews.author: Fiber Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great, but WASH with soap and water first
customer_reviews.text: Great value and built well but I have sensitivities to oils, etc. on tools, etc. from where this comes from and have found that washing them in soap and water completely is a thing worth remembering..
customer_reviews.author: Barry S Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Good for whacking.
customer_reviews.text: This is a hard rubber mallet with a white side to prevent marking up of what ever you are whacking. This is not a hammer, it is mostly good for whacking off things that you don't want to dent or pummel. If you want to dent or pummel, use a hammer. This is a rubber whacker
customer_reviews.author: R.N.R.N.

customer_reviews.title: Rubber is tearing where Im driving in metal stakes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help drive yard stakes into the ground, but its ripping the rubber on the 1st use. Not sure I'm going to keep this if its going to tear. The heaviness is really nice, but the rubber needs to be a different material that wont cut if your hammering something sharp
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Mc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy And High Quality
customer_reviews.text: It's a rubber mallet, so there really isn't a whole lot to say, other than it has a nice feel in hand, is very sturdy and seems to be of top quality. I have no complaints and it seems like it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: El Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this just for weed barrier stakes (the small ones). A week after using it, it's chipping and falling apart. Not durable at all. Amazon return window closed a couple of days ago, so we are stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mando

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight tool - Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Rubber Hammer at a great price! Actually, this product is better than I had expected. It's very lightweight - only 16 ozs. It's very well constructed and I love the handle grip. It works perfectly for my needs when I want the power and force of momentum as that of a regular hammer, but NOT the nicks, scratches, or dents on the object I'm striking. This has just the right amount of power! I'm very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ms67GTO

customer_reviews.title: Handy Mallet to have just incase
customer_reviews.text: Overall a pretty great mallet that feels better and is better priced than those you find at home depot or lowes. Did what I needed to do and looks like it'll hold up for many years. Build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Seemingly solid tool but has manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a pretty solid, well made tool. It just has some kind of weird manufacturing error. I'm assuming that's what it is. I've reached the conclusion that it's still completely capable of filling the hearts of tiny children with terror if wielded with the appropriate amount of menace. One should practice beforehand to ensure a performance to die for. I don't imagine it will effect how well the tool performs, but I could see it causing premature wear and tear. Cracks
customer_reviews.author: Joe Evans

customer_reviews.title: Built Well
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the hammer. Had some indentations when I tried to hammer in a metal spike though. Guess it was my fault. Should have used a hammer! I like the feel of it though. Feels good in your hand, has a good weight. Doesn't feel like it would break even if I went to town on it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and long term tool
customer_reviews.text: This has worked very well. Have used for several projects around the house and yard and it is durable and has worked very well for hammering surfaces that are subject to damage from a regular hammer. Looks like a tool that will be in use for many years as to durability. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Beryl

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do. Double head is really nice feature. Soft rubber side is excellent for getting metal and wood into alignment without marring surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Boi Named Sous

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: There are times when a rubber mallet is the best tool to tap a surface rather than use a hammer. Just glad we have one now. This is a very good tool. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Very strong rubber hammer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and very strong hammer. I use it for fixing my loosing wood floor. Only problem is the handle.Feel not comfortable when holding. Everything else are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Head has held up. Got a few indents from hitting things I’m not supposed to. Hasn’t crumbled or cracked. Handle fits hand well. Head hits were brain thinks it will.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: for the price it's great for smaller projects
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up basically to help with some engineered flooring I was switching out and for the price it did it's job, If your doing your own floor installation this mallet Is definitely Better than the little one that comes with the all in one kits. It's hard to be too critical of a tool like this when they Sell for this price.
customer_reviews.author: MatthewGB

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for staking tents
customer_reviews.text: Its a mallet. A much better choice than the inexpensive camping mallets for hammering in tent stakes on the camping trip. If that's what you need it for, buy it. I'm stoked w mine.
customer_reviews.author: chili con cookie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for driving plastics into ground
customer_reviews.text: It seems these days many things for the garden are made of plastics. Using a metal hammer or wooden mallet can break supports but this rubber mallet is perfect for the job. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many wooden handle mallets for our family business, and after a few months of use, the wooden handle always seems to break at the base of the mallet head. This product seems much more sturdy and I expect it to last a lot longer even though it costs a few dollar more!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W Savage

customer_reviews.title: Much rubber, vary hammer.
customer_reviews.text: The Ferrari of cars, but if cars were like, hammers. It was black and red just like we hoped it would be. Rubber portion was bouncy and had a fragrant natural rubber odor that made it ideal for what we are using it for, As a child I always dreamed of someday owning a hammer like this and I was overjoyed when that dream finally became a reality. This tool truly puts the fear of god into tent steaks and other pointy things that have a phobia of being smashed into the earth.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer afficianado

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use it on spin doctors.
customer_reviews.text: Completely destroyed after one job using spin doctor spacers on a wall. The plastic posts left behind break off decently but this got eaten alive and left chunks of its materials black and white everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Myles JD Pestka

customer_reviews.title: Great Balance
customer_reviews.text: Using it to help screen in our back porch. Using Screen Tight system and this works great knocking the connectors into the track. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bryant

customer_reviews.title: If I Had a Hammer . . .
customer_reviews.text: It's rubber mallet hammer. Will it change your life? Let's hope not. If you need a rubber mallet hammer, though, this is as good as they come.
customer_reviews.author: J from GA

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: Needed a mallet and this one fit the bill both on quality and price. This thing is hefty and can take a beating. Mallet head is firm but not abrasive. I can tell this will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: W. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Mallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent mallet with a good weight. It is advertised as fiberglass however there is a piece of plastic connecting the mallet to the handle. I know this because it broke shortly after buying it. I still use it as I just tied the mallet to the handle with some rope. I wouldn’t advertise this as heavy duty at all, but it does the job and is pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Eunoia_1323

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: Even tho the mallet is of Asian origin, it's a higher quality mallet. It doesn't come across as a disposable product.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The mallet is very sturdy and works just ike it should. I like the fiberglass handle versus a wood handle. GREAT Value.
customer_reviews.author: SKYGUY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rubber mallet ~ Perfect for assembling heavy duty items
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent rubber mallet. I used it to assemble a kitchen workstation, and it performed flawlessly. It's very well made and capable of taking on a lot of punishment.
customer_reviews.author: Expressed Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality - really tried to get one locally from a brick & mortar store - but - just couldn’t find one that I liked & that wasn’t stupidly over priced ... this one works great ...
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the head is not that good!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the head is not that good! I have only used it one and it seems like if used it for at least three months
customer_reviews.author: julian puentes

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good quality, has worked fine for me
customer_reviews.text: It’s a mallet that works and is the size advertised. Not expensive, but good quality. Recommended for casual use
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Quite good
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for someone so my review is based on what I saw and not actually using it. It seems quite good as its very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna J.

customer_reviews.title: Still In One Piece
customer_reviews.text: After breaking my wooden handle mallet in half, I decided to invest in this fiberglass handle. So far it stays in one piece. It also feels well balanced and solid. The black head does stain things as you whack them. Maybe put a cloth or paper down first if you don't want them marked.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I used this to help bang together some metal shelves my husband and I assembled for the storage room. It worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha A.

customer_reviews.title: It's a rubber mallet. Not much to go wrong here.
customer_reviews.text: It is cheap and is built well. No issues to complain of. I don't see a reason to buy something more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Price

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have a rubber mallet!
customer_reviews.text: It's not something you need every day, but when you need it, there's nothing else that will do... in my experience. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: ConsiderThis

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy mallet and is perfect for pounding stakes into the ground as well as for using when trying to prevent scratches or dents. Multiple uses and very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality for low price.
customer_reviews.text: Have already used my Tekton rubber mallet a few times and its perfect. Well built, perfect weight, and amazing price.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Berry

customer_reviews.title: worked good for a lot of the house remodeling I was ...
customer_reviews.text: worked good for a lot of the house remodeling I was doing but the head ending up breaking off. good thing I got two. second one has been working since. might have over used it but I feel like the head shouldn't have broke after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Hammer time
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good hammer but one smack against my chisel handle and a huge piece chipped off. Other than that it’s sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mackintosh

customer_reviews.title: Nice well made rubber hammer
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace my $3.00 rubber mallet, decided to go a little more upscale on this purchase and like TEKTON tools. Very happy with the build quality of this mallet, works perfectly for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Just another hammer??
customer_reviews.text: You can by a similar hammer anywhere for roughly the same price. ( Although this is a pretty competitive price) BUT what you can’t get with the competition is the customer service of Tekton. This will be the last hammer you buy because Tekton will guarantee it forever.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good deal on a better than average mallet.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have time to run to Wmart to get a super cheap one for camping but I'm glad I ended up with this. This thing is much sturdier than the wooden handle units I've bought before. I use for pounding in plastic stakes for my screen room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor connection between handle and head
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these and the handles came apart from the heads in the first week of use. Can't be fixed. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: karatekai

customer_reviews.title: Hammer time
customer_reviews.text: I don’t really know what to say other than it hammers. It’s simple, cheap, lightweight, you can bang stuff with it. What more could you want in a hammer?! If you want to reshape metal without damaging it, this rubber mallet will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Jim problem solved
customer_reviews.text: Well, it does the job. I got sick of my neighbor always mouthing off so I gave him a good thump on his neck with this thing and he folded like a cheap lawn chair. Not so mouthy now are you Jim.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Tekton 32oz. mallet
customer_reviews.text: Solid , sturdy mallet. Feels good in your hand. Good price and perfect for all around use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good mallet!
customer_reviews.text: Good mallet. Worked for tent stakes and also for breaking apart some lumber from pallets.
customer_reviews.author: Bsmom

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my mountain bike to break free or install parts without damaging the bike, works excellently.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Sturdy. Good value. Used for a paver project and I’m glad I didn’t overpay.
customer_reviews.author: Jumping Beans

customer_reviews.title: heavy
customer_reviews.text: I use this to straighten out my pavers, works like a champ without damaging the pavers.
customer_reviews.author: RW D

customer_reviews.title: Great for campers
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rubber mallet to use while camping, mostly for hammering stakes into the ground. this is perfect for that. Light weight and perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Didnt hold up very well, after about a month the rubber started cracking and splitting.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Handle ended up coming off on both of these we bought after several months of mostly light use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stange

customer_reviews.title: Yep, that's a rubber mallet.
customer_reviews.text: Does things a rubber mallet is supposed to do. 32oz is heavy to hold if you're a woman with not so muscular arms, but that just means I need to bulk up.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap hammer.
customer_reviews.text: You get what u pay for I guess. White side is perfectly flat, black side is a little bit rounded. Came with chips and cracks all along the seems. Maybe try all one color to see if it is any better.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Beach!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it is a great mallet. I bought this to use for hitting beach spikes and rod holders. Very sturdy and will get the job done. I just am curious to see how many seasons it will hold up. Doesn't mark or damage the pvc tubing at all.
customer_reviews.author: JDuncan

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap mallet solution
customer_reviews.text: If you need a rubber mallet, spend the few extra bucks and get one that won't break after the first few swings. I've had this happen to several of the wooden mallets available on Amazon -- hickory handles these are not! So fiberglass is the next best thing. This is just a basic mallet but stands up to a great deal more abuse than cheap wood handle mallets. Save yourself the trouble and just buy something that will last.
customer_reviews.author: vardelda

customer_reviews.title: Yes it is a mallet
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a mallet. Heavy, well made, and works! Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great basic mallet.
customer_reviews.text: I got this in order to build a bunch of steel shelving units a little easier. I've found that it's always nice to have a rubber mallet on hand to make sure the shelves are pushed down tight. I couldn't find the one I already own but this one was very affordable and delivered in 2 days, thanks to Prime. It's comfortable to carry and swing. It does the job I need it to do very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great rubber mallet
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Seems to be holding up after a few jobs. Good quality mallet
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Rubber mallett
customer_reviews.text: I have not got a chance to use it but I am glad to have it just in case
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My hand and wrist aren't as strong as they once were, so I've been looking for something to help with chopping through bones with my cleaver. This mallet fit the bill. Not much recoil on impact and the face of it is holding up really well. I can get through chicken and spare ribs easily with this.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy and powerful--ready for some serious pounding, but just soft enough not to leave marks. Best mallet I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mallet to hit wood dowels and the rubber has been chipping away from first use. By the end of the summer, I should just have a handle. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: branden pedrosa

product_meta.title: TEKTON 16 oz. Fiberglass Handle White/Black Rubber Mallet | 30683
product_meta.description: Size:16 oz.| Color:White/BlackIdeal for construction, woodworking, and automotive applications, the versatile TEKTON 16 oz. Fiberglass Handle White/Black Rubber Mallet has a non-marking white face and soft black face that each deliver a softened strike that won't damage metal, wood, and other hard surfaces.
feature_bullets: Dual-material head features one soft black face and one non-marking white face
Solid rubber head delivers a softened positive strike
High-strength fiberglass handle core helps absorb vibrations
Exterior poly jacket protects handle core from missed strikes
Soft, nonslip rubber grip is a directly integrated piece of the handle that can never pull loose
Made for construction, woodworking, and automotive applications
